channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Roadworks signs blocking pavement, 20th October
item.description:
5 roadwork signs along the pavement. Pedestrians are forces to step in the road to get round. The other side footpath is closed so there is no safe system for pedestrians to walk along the road without stepping into the path of motor vehicles. I saw two elderly ladies nearly get hit by a car. The worst sign is the one telling drivers to stop at the red light. It covers the whole path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mayplace Road West, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned Vehicle, 20th October
item.description:
There is an abandoned vehicle parked up outside No. 2 Wessex Drive since 3rd October and none of the occupants of the surrounding houses know whose car this is and now the passenger side rear window has been smashed. Neighbours suspect it could have be stolen and dumped.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Wessex Drive, North End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 80 Neal street, 20th October
item.description:
The road surface outside 80 and 82 Neal street is uneven and had caused many members of the public to trip and hurt themselves. The surface is uneven and therefore extremely dangerous
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 80, Neal Street, Bloomsbury, London

item.title: Outside 80 Neal Street, 20th October

item.title: Cut down tree, 20th October
item.description:
I have reported the tree that had been cut down in fix my streets ref 8275361 and got a reply that said it has been resolved. This is not the answer I require. I wish for a reply as to why the tree has been felled as it seemed a healthy tree. Please do not close this down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 76, Bladindon Drive, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road pools all along the road soaking pedestrians, 20th October
item.description:
This whole road pools loads of surface water in many various places- from number 1-15 the road surface has a defect which pools water, there is no drain that alleviates the water build up and so innocent pedestrians get soaked by careless drivers travelling along this road. Outside 31 onwards the road surface has lots of dips and ripples in it causing whiplash due to parked cars on the pavement side, as the road surface on the bushes side is tragic and needs resurfacing urgently! At the Gwillam close end there are several drains that are inches above the road surface so this is also a defect because how will water ever travel down them alleviating puddles? Fact is they won’t. So these drains need to be lowered and resurfacing needs to happen here too!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Park Mead, Blendon, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People firing litter into 6he ait with no idea where it's going to land. This is littering., 20th October
item.description:
Unfortunately no category for noise nuisance, so reporting 3rd night of fireworks in a row in Barnehurst area. More and more use outside of 5th Nov in recent yrs. Besides well-documented noise impact on wildlife, pets, military vets, kids sleeping and general public, this is also wilful littering. People responsible just randomly throwing yet more litter into wider environment.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thirlmere Road, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwork traffic light phasing leading to blocked road, 20th October
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 120, Lower Road, Rotherhithe, London
